case_vignette: A 29-year-old male presents with painful genital ulcers ongoing for the past 3 months! He reports multiple new female sexual partners and unprotected sex! He has tried over the counter antifungal creams without any relief! Physical examination reveals five painful, purulent well demarcated ulcers with yellow fibrinous bases along the penile coronal sulcus and dorsal shaft! Tender bilateral inguinal lymphadenitis is appreciated! A rapid HIV test is performed and is negative!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have painful sores on my genital area and swelling in the groin that's been there for the past 3 months.
Have you experienced flu-like symptoms, such as fever or body aches, along with your current symptoms?
No, I haven't experienced flu-like symptoms such as fever or body aches.
Have you had similar symptoms in the past?
No, I have not had similar symptoms in the past.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I do not have any other medical conditions and I am not taking any medications.
Have you engaged in unprotected sexual contact?
Yes, I have had unprotected sex with multiple new partners.
Final Diagnosis: Genital herpes.
